properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Lawrence, IL; Knox, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 12:52PM EST until January 27 at 5:30PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Wabash River...White River...


.Minor flooding continues in west central and southwest Indiana on
the Wabash and White Rivers.

Flooding on the White River should end by tomorrow morning.  Along
the Wabash, flooding is expected to last until mid-week. Another
weather system is due by the end of the month.  Is is too early to
tell if this will have an effect on area waterways.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Vincennes.
* until Monday afternoon.
* At 12:45 PM Sunday the stage was 17.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 17.5 feet by this afternoon then
begin falling. It will fall below flood stage late tonight.
* At 18.0 feet...Agricultural lands and some oil fields flood.
Several township roads about 1.25 miles south of St. Francesville
and River Road between Billett Road and Lincoln Memorial Bridge in
Lawrence County are flooded.  Extensive flooding of Kimmell Park at
Vincennes.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
